intro: Cohniella bolivianensis, commonly known as the Bolivian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a slightly hairy texture. Cohniella bolivianensis is often found in rocky or arid environments, where it has adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
